items.title: AI Bots Are Now a Signifigant Source of Web Traffic

items.title: Scotland's rising star Brown poised for sliding doors moment
items.summary: It is a matter of when, not if, Gregor Brown becomes a cornerstone of Scotland's forward pack, writes Tom English.

items.title: 'We've dealt with it' - McCullum defends 'outstanding' Brook

items.summary: Jupiter is smaller and flatter than scientists previously thought, new measurements of the gas giant reveal.

items.title: 206 goals for Newcastle - but which were Shearer's best?

items.title: 'Quite annoying that we keep going on and on about it' - McCullum defends squad
items.summary: In a wide-ranging interview, Brendon McCullum talks about Harry Brook's altercation with a nightclub bouncer and the criticism of England's off-field behaviour.

items.title: Team GB's childhood friends fired up for revenge
items.summary: Bruce Mouat and Jen Dodds are fired up to make amends on Wednesday for the agony of their mixed doubles curling semi-final against Norway in 2022.

items.title: Quiz: Name every sport at the 2026 Winter Olympics
items.summary: The 25th Winter Olympics is taking place in Milan and Cortina in Italy - can you name the 16 sports involved?

items.title: 'Text me a proof of life!' - Chris Hughes' bobsleigh run with Team GB
items.summary: TV personality Chris Hughes meets GB's bobsleigh team, but will he go down the mountain against the 5G of force in a two man sled?

items.title: Harden to join Cavaliers in pursuit of first title
items.summary: James Harden is set to join the Cleveland Cavaliers from the Los Angeles Clippers, with Darius Garland moving in the opposite direction.

items.title: Why time is running out for Milan's iconic San Siro
items.summary: BBC Sport visits the San Siro in Milan, the venue for the Winter Olympics opening ceremony, to find out why this could be the last global event held at the iconic stadium, and what comes next.

items.title: Who won the WSL transfer window? Rate each club's deals
items.summary: BBC Sport pundits Steph Houghton, Ellen White, Karen Bardsley and Jen Beattie rate each WSL club's transfer window - and you can too.

items.title: France's Dupont 'a serious threat' - Gibson-Park
items.summary: Ireland scrum-half Jamison Gibson-Park says that France captain Antoine Dupont can "do stuff that not many others are capable of" ahead of Thursday's opening Six Nations game in Paris (20:10 GMT).

items.title: How France are shaping up for Six Nations defence
items.summary: With excitement rising for this year's Stade de France curtain-raiser against Ireland, BBC Sport NI looks at how France are shaping up for their Six Nations title defence.

items.title: A deer carrying the rotting head of its vanquished foe and a playful lynx shortlisted for Wildlife Photographer of the Year Nuveen People's Choice Award
items.summary: Here are the 24 images shortlisted for the Wildlife Photographer of the Year Nuveen People's Choice Award 2026.

items.title: Grim photo captures polar bear mom and cubs resting in mud in summer heat
items.summary: An image of polar bears napping along the Hudson Bay coast in Canada has been shortlisted for the Wildlife Photographer of the Year Nuveen People's Choice Award 2026.

items.title: 'Years in the making' - are Arsenal ready to shed 'nearly-men' tag?
items.summary: Arsenal have moved a step closer to winning their first major silverware since 2020 by beating Chelsea 4-2 on aggregate in the Carabao Cup semi-final.

items.title: Chelsea adopt Match of the Day tactic to stop Arsenal set-piece threat
items.summary: Despite losing their Carabao Cup semi-final, Chelsea attempted a new way of stopping Arsenal set-pieces - just days after a similar suggestion on Match of the Day.

items.title: Liverpool to rival Man Utd for Wharton - Wednesday's gossip
items.summary: Liverpool, Manchester United and Real Madrid eye Adam Wharton deal, Manchester United could move for Jean-Philippe Mateta and Sandro Tonali, Leeds keeper Illan Meslier looks to be heading to Turkey.

items.title: An â€˜Intimacy Crisisâ€™ Is Driving the Dating Divide
items.summary: In his book The Intimate Animal, sex and relationships researcher Justin Garcia says people have miscalculated their need for human intimacy, which is the real issue at the root of the loneliness epidemic.

items.title: Asteroid 2024 YR4's collision with the moon could create a flash visible from Earth, study finds
items.summary: If the building-size asteroid 2024 YR4 crashes into the moon in December 2032, the impact will produce a bright flash that may be visible to the naked eye, a new study finds.

items.title: Walmart Is Being Accused Of Significantly Hiking Up Meat Prices
items.summary: A viral grocery investigation is putting scales in the spotlight.

items.title: Men develop cardiovascular disease 7 years before women, study suggests. But why?
items.summary: Men's heart health tends to decline earlier in life, and the difference is driven largely by coronary heart disease, which appears roughly a decade sooner in men than in women.

items.title: Tactics, transfers and turmoil - inside the fall of Amorim
items.summary: After 14 months, Ruben Amorim has been sacked by Manchester United - but where did it all go wrong?

items.title: Booze, beach, beaten - how England lost the Ashes
items.summary: BBC Sport chief cricket reporter Stephan Shemilt reveals the inside story of England's Ashes defeat in Australia on and off the pitch.

items.title: I've realised I can make a difference - Hoy
items.summary: In a new BBC documentary, Sir Chris Hoy shows how he is using his Olympic mindset to reframe his purpose following a terminal cancer diagnosis.

items.title: Inside McLaren's season - the rules, values, incidents & relationships
items.summary: Intra-team title battles turn toxic far more often than not. Andrew Benson analyses how McLaren have maintained relative harmony between Lando Norris and Oscar Piastri.
